channel.title: Posts on Burke Holland
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Burke Holland

item.title: Selecting one from Cosmos DB
item.description: Sometimes, in life, you just want one of something. Not two. Never two. Just one. Like a toothbrush. Or a flu shot. Or a pug. Dear god, trust me, you do not want more than one pug. It’s like a choir of snoring with flatulance on backup vocals. This is common in database queries, too. I mean, the desire to just get one result. Not the flatulance. Although it might be.

item.title: Deploying a Nuxt app to Azure
item.description: summary { border: 1px solid #D2D2D2; border-radius: 10px; padding: 10px; } .azure-icon { float: left; height: 30px; margin-right: 10px; } figure { margin-top: 10px; } Summary: Nuxt apps with “server-side rendering” require a Node server, so you need to deploy them to Azure App Service. If you are using Nuxt apps in SPA mode, you can (and should) deploy them to Azure Storage. Check out the links below for more details… Deploy to Azure App Service Deploy a static website to Azure
